alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 5:59AM EST until January 14 at 4:16AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Monroe, Houston, Twiggs, Jones and Bibb Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Macon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding expands. An increasing amount of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail floods north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be around one foot deep on portions of the trail and both banks overflow upstream from the bridge. Large portions of agricultural lands well downstream will be under one to three feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM EST Saturday was 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.1 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 05/30/1923. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM EST.
